intro: Perityle angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf perityle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in the summer, producing small yellow to orange blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Perityle angustifolia is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
